are even your books I think are
generally students and intellectuals and
it seems to me one of my concerns and I

split between the intellectual left the
puty bouro intellectual left and the
workers whose concerns seem to be very
different now and there's a huge
difference you see for example in uh in
many countries when you complain about

actually get the workers vote in many

people who vote on the left tend to be

and so on so there's a big split there
is a sort of a strange situation there
it can be but
I I'm I'm speaking from my own
experiences mostly the United States and
I and England the other place where I am
often I don't to some extent I agree but
I don't think it's as sharp as that I
mean I speak to trade Union groups
they're working people they read the

working class mostly on employed working
class in the 30s very literate High
literary culture many of them never even
never went past elementary school but

of the Budapest string Quirk at reading

of
Psychiatry reading of course all the

Britain and the United States and it was
